text: Celebrities are revealing their reading habits by staging appearances in front of their bookshelves during the pandemic. So what exactly are they reading? Here’s what @nytimesbooks found. https://t.co/xlXSOFYSNs

name: nytimes
text:

The Presidential Recordings of Lyndon B. Johnson, Volumes 1-3: Transcripts of 700 hours of telephone conversations that Johnson secretly recorded https://t.co/xlXSOFYSNs https://t.co/d9z8LAwHQh

name: nytimes
text:
On Regina King’s bookshelf

“Tupac Shakur Legacy,” by Jamal Joseph: Curated by a family friend, this “interactive biography” of the rapper includes photos of Tupac’s home life and reproductions of handwritten lyrics https://t.co/xlXSOFYSNs https://t.co/aNe1IB13kT

name: nytimes
text:
On Gwyneth Paltrow’s bookshelf

“French Riviera: Living Well Was the Best Revenge,” by Xavier Girard: Glamorous photos of the creative rich and famous — like Picasso and Coco Chanel — who lived on the Mediterranean coast in the 1920s and 30s https://t.co/xlXSOFYSNs https://t.co/le2RaSwO3k

name: nytimes
text:
On Charlamagne tha God’s bookshelf

“The Autobiography of Malcolm X,” by Malcolm X and Alex Haley: The classic about the radicalization of Malcolm Little and how he turned himself into one of the most powerful thinkers on Black identity in the 20th century https://t.co/xlXSOFYSNs https://t.co/cnY20azIe8

name: nytimes
text:
On Patti LuPone’s bookshelf

“Stage Left,” by Jay Williams: A history of the radical theater movement of the 1930s when the Depression brought left-wing ideas to the stage, by a man who lived through the era as an actor and stage manager https://t.co/xlXSOFYSNs https://t.co/Ku75l22tCn
